Distributions

class PhaseTypeDistribution(pop_config: phasegen.population.PopConfig, state_space: phasegen.state_space.StateSpace, demography: phasegen.demography.Demography = <phasegen.demography.ConstantDemography object>, reward: phasegen.rewards.Reward = <phasegen.rewards.TreeHeightReward object>)

Bases: _MomentAwareDistribution

Phase-type distribution for a piecewise time-homogenous process.

max_epochs = 100

Maximum number iterations when iterating to convergence in the last epoch

__init__(pop_config: phasegen.population.PopConfig, state_space: phasegen.state_space.StateSpace, demography: phasegen.demography.Demography = <phasegen.demography.ConstantDemography object>, reward: phasegen.rewards.Reward = <phasegen.rewards.TreeHeightReward object>)

Initialize the distribution.

Parameters:

  • pop_config (PopConfig) – The population configuration.

  • state_space (StateSpace) – The state space.

  • demography (Demography) – The demography.

  • reward (Reward) – The reward.

pop_config: PopConfig

Population configuration

reward: Reward

Reward

state_space: StateSpace

State space

demography: Demography

Demography

Initial state vector.

Get the mean absorption time.

Returns:

The mean absorption time.

property var: float | phasegen.spectrum.SFS

Get the variance in the absorption time.

Returns:

The variance in the absorption time.

property std: float | phasegen.spectrum.SFS

Get the standard deviation in the absorption time.

Returns:

The standard deviation in the absorption time.

property m2: float | phasegen.spectrum.SFS

Get the (non-central) second moment.

Returns:

The second moment.

moment(k: int, rewards: Optional[Tuple[phasegen.rewards.Reward]] = None)

Get the nth (non-central) moment.

Parameters:

  • k (int) – The kth moment

  • rewards (Optional[Tuple[Reward]]) – Tuple of k rewards

Return type:

float

Returns:

The kth moment

touch()

Touch all cached properties.

class TreeHeightDistribution(pop_config: phasegen.population.PopConfig, state_space: phasegen.state_space.DefaultStateSpace, demography: phasegen.demography.Demography = <phasegen.demography.ConstantDemography object>, reward: phasegen.rewards.DefaultReward = <phasegen.rewards.TreeHeightReward object>)

Bases: PhaseTypeDistribution, _DensityAwareDistribution

Phase-type distribution for a piecewise time-homogenous process that allows the computation of the density function. This is currently only possible with default rewards.

__init__(pop_config: phasegen.population.PopConfig, state_space: phasegen.state_space.DefaultStateSpace, demography: phasegen.demography.Demography = <phasegen.demography.ConstantDemography object>, reward: phasegen.rewards.DefaultReward = <phasegen.rewards.TreeHeightReward object>)

Initialize the distribution.

Parameters:

  • pop_config (PopConfig) – The population configuration.

  • state_space (DefaultStateSpace) – The state space.

  • demography (Demography) – The demography.

  • reward (DefaultReward) – The reward.

state_space: DefaultStateSpace

State space

cdf(u: float | numpy.ndarray)

Cumulative distribution function.

Parameters:

u (float | ndarray) – Value or values to evaluate the CDF at.

Return type:

float | ndarray

Returns:

Cumulative probability

Raises:

NotImplementedError – if rewards are not default

quantile(q: float, expansion_factor: float = 2, tol: float = 1e-05, max_epochs: int = 1000)

Find the nth quantile of a CDF using an adaptive bisection method.

Parameters:

  • q (float) – The desired quantile (between 0 and 1).

  • expansion_factor (float) – Factor by which to expand the upper bound that does not yet contain the quantile.

  • tol (float) – The tolerance for convergence.

  • max_epochs (int) – Maximum number of iterations for the bisection method.

Returns:

The approximate x value for the nth quantile.

pdf(u: float | numpy.ndarray, dx: float = 1e-10)

Density function. We use numerical differentiation of the CDF to calculate the density. This provides good results as the CDF is exact and continuous.

Parameters:

  • u (float | ndarray) – Value or values to evaluate the density function at.

  • dx (float) – Step size for numerical differentiation.

Return type:

float | ndarray

Returns:

Density

property alpha: ndarray

Initial state vector.

property m2: float | phasegen.spectrum.SFS

Get the (non-central) second moment.

Returns:

The second moment.

max_epochs = 100

Maximum number iterations when iterating to convergence in the last epoch

property mean: float | phasegen.spectrum.SFS

  • rewards (Optional[Tuple[Reward]]) – Tuple of k rewards

plot_cdf(ax: Optional[matplotlib.axes._axes.Axes] = None, x: Optional[numpy.ndarray] = None, show: bool = True, file: Optional[str] = None, clear: bool = True, label: Optional[str] = None, title: str = 'CDF')

Plot cumulative distribution function.

Parameters:

  • ax (Optional[Axes]) – Axes to plot on.

  • x (Optional[ndarray]) – Values to evaluate the CDF at.

  • show (bool) – Whether to show the plot.

  • file (Optional[str]) – File to save the plot to.

  • clear (bool) – Whether to clear the plot before plotting.

  • label (Optional[str]) – Label for the plot.

  • title (str) – Title of the plot.

Return type:

axes

Returns:

Axes.

plot_pdf(ax: Optional[matplotlib.axes._axes.Axes] = None, x: Optional[numpy.ndarray] = None, show: bool = True, file: Optional[str] = None, clear: bool = True, label: Optional[str] = None, title: str = 'PDF')

Plot density function.

Parameters:

  • ax (Optional[Axes]) – The axes to plot on.

  • x (Optional[ndarray]) – Values to evaluate the density function at.

  • show (bool) – Whether to show the plot.

  • file (Optional[str]) – File to save the plot to.

  • clear (bool) – Whether to clear the plot before plotting.

  • label (Optional[str]) – Label for the plot.

  • title (str) – Title of the plot.

Return type:

axes

Returns:

Axes.

class SFSDistribution(pop_config: phasegen.population.PopConfig, state_space: phasegen.state_space.BlockCountingStateSpace, demography: phasegen.demography.Demography, pbar: bool = False, parallelize: bool = False)

Bases: PhaseTypeDistribution

Site-frequency spectrum distribution.

__init__(pop_config: phasegen.population.PopConfig, state_space: phasegen.state_space.BlockCountingStateSpace, demography: phasegen.demography.Demography, pbar: bool = False, parallelize: bool = False)

Initialize the distribution.

Parameters:

  • pop_config (PopConfig) – The population configuration.

  • state_space (BlockCountingStateSpace) – Block counting state space.

  • demography (Demography) – The demography.

  • pbar (bool) – Whether to show a progress bar.

  • parallelize (bool) – Use parallelization.

pbar: bool

Whether to show a progress bar

parallelize: bool

Whether to parallelize computations

moment(k: int, i: Optional[int] = None)

Get the nth moment.

Parameters:

  • k (int) – The order of the moment

  • i (Optional[int]) – The ith SFS count. Return full SFS if not specified.

Return type:

SFS | float

Returns:

The nth moment

property cov: SFS2

If no arguments are given, get the 2-SFS, i.e. the covariance matrix of the site-frequencies.

Returns:

A 2-SFS or a single covariance value.

get_cov(i: int, j: int)

Get the covariance between the ith and jth site-frequency.

Parameters:

  • i (int) – The ith site-frequency

  • j (int) – The jth site-frequency

Return type:

float

Returns:

property corr: SFS2

If no arguments are given, get the 2-SFS, i.e. the correlation matrix of the site-frequencies. If i and j are given, get the correlation coefficient between the ith and jth site-frequency.

Returns:

The correlation coefficient matrix

get_corr(i: int, j: int)

Get the correlation coefficient between the ith and jth site-frequency.

Parameters:

  • i (int) – The ith site-frequency

  • j (int) – The jth site-frequency

Return type:

float

Returns:

Correlation coefficient

property alpha: ndarray

Initial state vector.

Get the (non-central) second moment.

Returns:

The second moment.

Maximum number iterations when iterating to convergence in the last epoch

class Coalescent(n: typing.Union[int, typing.Dict[str, int], typing.List[int], phasegen.population.PopConfig], model: phasegen.coalescent_models.CoalescentModel = <phasegen.coalescent_models.StandardCoalescent object>, demography: typing.Optional[phasegen.demography.Demography] = None, pbar: bool = True, parallelize: bool = True)

Bases: _AbstractCoalescent

Coalescent distribution for the piecewise time-homogeneous coalescent.

__init__(n: typing.Union[int, typing.Dict[str, int], typing.List[int], phasegen.population.PopConfig], model: phasegen.coalescent_models.CoalescentModel = <phasegen.coalescent_models.StandardCoalescent object>, demography: typing.Optional[phasegen.demography.Demography] = None, pbar: bool = True, parallelize: bool = True)

Create object.

Parameters:

  • n (:param) – n: Number of lineages. Either a single integer if only one population, or a list of integers or a dictionary with population names as keys and number of lineages as values. Alternatively, a PopulationConfig object can be passed.

  • model (CoalescentModel) – Coalescent model.

  • pbar (bool) – Whether to show a progress bar

  • parallelize (bool) – Whether to parallelize computations

demography: Demography

Time-homogeneous demography

pbar: bool

Whether to show a progress bar

parallelize: bool

Whether to parallelize computations

property tree_height: TreeHeightDistribution

Tree height distribution.

property total_branch_length: PhaseTypeDistribution

Total branch length distribution.

property sfs: SFSDistribution

Site frequency spectrum distribution.

pop_config: PopConfig

Population configuration

model: CoalescentModel

Coalescent model
